intro: Crassula suavis, commonly known as the sweet crassula, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It features fleshy, oval-shaped leaves that are typically green with a slight reddish tint. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink during the warmer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires moderate sunlight. Due to its compact size and ornamental appeal, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation.
